message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: import java.io.*;

public class DataStreams {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream("C:\\data.txt"));
            for (int i = 1; i <= 9; i++) {
                out.writeInt(i);
            }
            out.close();
            System.out.println("Data file created successfully.");
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            System.out.println("Error creating data file: " + ioe.getMessage());
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue with your code is that you are using the `write` method of `DataOutputStream` to write individual bytes instead of using the `writeInt` method to write integers. By using `write`, you are writing the ASCII values of the numbers instead of the actual numbers. Additionally, make sure to close the `DataOutputStream` after writing the data. The updated code above writes the numbers 1 to 9 as integers and closes the stream properly.
